pull.title: Travis CI bug in macOS environment #17178 workaround
pull.body:
According to #17178 by MarcoFalke, `cd` command (using for changing directory) has some conflicts with Travis builtin command with similar name in some environments (like macOS).

In this PR :
1. I tried to solve this issue by replacing `cd` by `type cd` in `ci/test/06_script_a.sh` and `ci/test/06_script_b.sh` .
2. I added function called `safe_cd` as commented in [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16597/files#r336052676) to avoid duplication in code.

rename.to: Travis CI bug in macOS environment solved #17178

rename.from: Travis CI bug in macOS environment solved #17178
rename.to: Travis CI bug in macOS environment #17178 solved

events.message: fix : travis macOS enviroment bug fixed #17178
add : safe_cd function added to script_a.sh
add : safe_cd function added to script_b.sh

events.body: Why did you close this? I think `safe_cd` is a reasonable workaround. But I would change the PR title, because it doesn't really "solve" the problem.

events.message: test : cd command replaced with type cd for macOS in Travis test
fix : extra space for assignments removed

events.body:
I'm OK with this if it solves a problem.

But to be honest I think this is terrible. Even a basic command that has existed since the 70's like `cd` needs a workaround these days? This makes it impossible to do shell scripting sanely. Are you going to review new code for using the right `cd` variant?

> I'm OK with this if it solves a problem.
> 
> But to be honest I think this is terrible. Even a basic command that has existed since the 70's like `cd` needs a workaround these days? This makes it impossible to do shell scripting sanely. Are you going to review new code for using the right `cd` variant?

Unfortunately Travis CI is in it's Betha version and has several bugs in macOS environment.
In this specific issue, i am going to use `type cd` instead of `cd` in macOS and continue using `cd` for other operating systems.
In macOS, Travis considers `cd` command as it's built-in Travis command and not as a shell scripting command :cry:.

>  In macOS, Travis considers cd command as it's built-in Travis command and not as a shell scripting command cry.

why? is there any documention available? What would happen if we forced it to use the shell built in?

events.message: add : comments are added to scripts

rename.from: Travis CI bug in macOS environment #17178 solved
rename.to: Travis CI bug in macOS environment #17178 workaround

events.body:
> > In macOS, Travis considers cd command as it's built-in Travis command and not as a shell scripting command cry.
> 
> why? is there any documention available? What would happen if we forced it to use the shell built in?

I really don't know :disappointed: 
I searched for a document for this specific issue, but i didn't find one.
Actually there is some issues in Travis repository like [this](https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/10165) that concerns about similar problem.

How can i force Travis to use shell built in? 
Any help will be appreciated :hand:
So what is the output of `which cd`, `type cd` and `command -v cd`?

> How can i force Travis to use shell built in?

We should use `which` / `type` as marco suggested to actually debug this and figure out the problem so it can be fixed upstream. But replacing `cd` with `command cd` would force using the built in.

> > How can i force Travis to use shell built in?
> 
> We should use `which` / `type` as marco suggested to actually debug this and figure out the problem so it can be fixed upstream. But replacing `cd` with `command cd` would force using the built in.

Thank you for your help :+1: 
So i am going to use `command cd` instead of `cd` in all OSs(including macOs and ...) and use `type cd` before any usage of `command cd` in code for future debug in upstream.
Did i understand you right?
No, without knowing what the result (output) of `type cd` and `which cd` is, there is nothing we can do

events.message: test : (type cd) and (which cd) command added for debug
fix : unused codes are now commented

events.body:
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/601781884#L228

says

```
cd is a function

cd () 

{ 

    __zsh_like_cd cd "$@"

}
Anyone has any idea how to overwrite this `cd`? Can we use `pushd` maybe?

> Anyone has any idea how to overwrite this `cd`? Can we use `pushd` maybe?

pushd probably won't help: 
https://github.com/rvm/rvm/blob/ad02fb2c7ae77c7fd92a4f68766a2c8140766d08/scripts/cd#L14-L16

I think we should debug this further (maybe turn on `set -x` or look at `type __zsh_like_cd` output) and figure out why the `__zsh_like_cd` function is dying on mac with errexit, then report the issue to travis so it can be fixed, and in the meantime add a safe_cd function that either calls `command cd` or just toggles `errexit` before calling regular `cd`.
Might be issue reported https://github.com/rvm/rvm/issues/4618#issuecomment-465145635 fixed by https://github.com/rvm/rvm/pull/4711

Good find @ryanofsky 

So upgrading to 1.29.9 (https://github.com/rvm/rvm/commit/8a3bf6a12f560c3b415224c5d6d6c195715fc59d) should fix this.

See here: https://rvm.io/rvm/upgrading
`pushd` definitely doesn't help; I tried that before.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17423](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17423.html) (ci: Make ci system read-only on the git work tree by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.body: at least add a comment for this workaround here: why this is needed, and when it can be removed again
